data.title: Shippensburg University Athletics
data.meta_description: Shippensburg University head wrestling coach Seth Bloomquist has confirmed the recruitment of four student-athletes who will be a part of the Raider wrestling room
data.text:
Wrestling announces 2024-25 recruiting class

Four recruits among the newcomers to join Raider wrestling for the 2024-25 season

8/6/2024 1:00:00 PM

SHIPPENSBURG, Pa. – Shippensburg University head wrestling coach Seth Bloomquist has confirmed the recruitment of four student-athletes who will be a part of the Raider wrestling room for the 2024-25 season.

The incoming class features three freshmen and one graduate transfer representing three different states: Pennsylvania, New Jersey and Virginia.

The class is headlined by former Bucknell wrestler Nick Delp, who captained the Bison wrestling team in 2023-24.

Additional newcomers will be listed on the team's 2024-25 roster.

The recruits are as follows (in alphabetical order):

Anthony DeAngelo

174

Carlisle, Pa./Trinity

Trinity High School: Totaled four varsity letters for the Shamrocks under head coach Joe Perretta…competed at the club level for D3 Training Center under coach Brent Zieders…is a two-time state qualifier…a two-time sectional champion (2023, 2024)…2024 District 3 runner-up…a 2024 Mid Penn Conference (MPC) Second Team All-Star…115 career wins and 53 career pins…also competed in mountain biking.

About DeAngelo: Full name is Anthony John DeAngelo…is the son of Tim and Gail DeAngelo.

Nick Delp

157

New Kensington, Pa./Kiski Area (Bucknell)

2023 (Senior): Attended Bucknell University…served as team captain…went 5-5 as a starter.

2022 (Junior): Attended Bucknell University…contributed a 12-10 record…placed fifth at Eastern Intercollegiate Wrestling Association (EIWA) Championships…was one match short of qualifying for nationals… earned the EIWA Academic Achievement Award.

2021 (Sophomore): Attended Bucknell University…contributed a 16-13 record…placed seventh EIWA Championships…was one match short of qualifying for nationals…scored a win over a Top-20 ranked opponent at Oklahoma State.

2020 (Freshman): Attended Bucknell University…posted a 4-4 record.

Kiski Area High School: Totaled four varsity letters for the Cavaliers under coaches Chris Heater, Chuck Tursky, Matt Kiebler and Donald Toy…wrestled at the club level for Quest School of Wrestling under coach Jim Akerly…placed eighth at states in 2019…a three-time state qualifier…boasted a career record of 147-37…a two-time NHSCA High School All-American, placing fifth in NHSCA High School Nationals as a sophomore and sixth as a junior…a two-time Powerade place winner…three-time Western Pennsylvania Interscholastic Athletic League (WPIAL) team champion (2017, 2018, 2019)…PIAA team runner-up in 2018…two-time PIAA team third place finisher (2017, 2019)…two-time Westmoreland County Coaches Association (WCCA) Tournament champion and three-time finalist…four-time Section I finalist…two third place finishes and a fourth-place finish at the individual WPIAL tournament…named team captain as a senior and Co-MVP…a Valley News Dispatch All-Star.

About Delp: Full name is Nicholas Oliver Delp…is the son of Jason and Teresa Delp…has a brother, Alexander…brother wrestled at Pitt and Pitt-Johnstown.

Aiden Inzana

149

King George, Va./King George

King George High School: Totaled four varsity letters for the Foxes under head coach Jeff Kraisser…competed at the club level for Wild Buffalo Wrestling Club under coach Jon Barr…a two-time All-State selection (2023, 2024)…state runner-up as a junior…placed third in the state as a senior…a three-time district champion…regional champion…100 match-winner…career 126-16 record…also lettered in cross country, baseball and track & field.

About Inzana: Full name is Aiden Paul Inzana…is the son of Jason and Rhonda Inzana…has a brother, Kaleb.

Matt Jones

285

Hillsborough, N.J./Hillsborough

Hillsborough High School: Totaled four varsity letters for the Raiders under coaches Rhys Weinberger, Justin Balunsat and Edwin Aguilera…complete at the club level for Yale Street Wrestling Club under coach Donnie DeFilippis…a three-time state qualifier…two-time district champion…two-time Somerset County Champion…a First Team All-Skyland Conference selection…member of the 100-win club…served as Student Council President and American Legion Jersey Boys State (ALJBS) Lt. Governor.

About Jones: Full name is Matthew Robert Jones…is the son of Rob and Meaghan Jones…has a sister, Emily.
